conversations.content: Welcome to the Halidom, Princess. Please make yourself at home.
Emblian Princess Veronica
Your room will be just over there. Do you have any other questions?
You're Heroes from another world, so why can't I make a contract with you?
Er, sorry?
Why won't you become mine? ...Bah. I'm bored already.
Oh, wait! We still haven't explained the communal...space... And she's gone.
Well, she's a barrel of laughs.
But she's going to be living here for a while, so we'll just have to find a way for all of us to get along.
Greetings, Veronica. If you have come here in search of a sparring partner, I would be happy to oblige you.
Not interested.
Oh! Well...all right.
Are you feeling hungry, Veronica? I just finished making stew.
I'm fine.
Er, fair enough...
Heeey, Veronica! Ya wanna head into town and get some grub? My treat!
Leave me alone.
*sigh* This is proving surprisingly difficult.
I know! Every time we ask her to do somethin', we get the cold shoulder.
She's the exact opposite of Sarisse. How in the world are we supposed to make friends with someone like that?!
Additionally, she's always in her room, which means I'm never able to clean—
Bad news! A group of imperial soldiers is approaching the castle!
Get ready, everyone. We're moving out.
Wait.
Er, what is it, Princess?
I'm coming.
You're our guest. We can't ask you to fi—
I'm bored. Let me come.
Well, all right. But please don't do anything that puts you in danger.
Your time has come, filthy criminals! Now you'll learn what happens when you make an enemy of the Dyrenell Empire!
Damn, there sure are a lot of 'em. Just hang back, Princess, yeah? We can protect ya better if yer... Uh oh.
You're the enemy, right? So I can play with you until you break?
Huh? Get out of here, kid! You're gonna get yourself hurt.
Are you threatening me? A shame. I think you need to die now.
Huh?! Hey, s-stop! STOOOOP!
Be you a child or not, no one gets away with treating the Empire like—AAAAARGH!
Why so scared? You started this. Don't you want to be played with?
Eeeek! I don't wanna die! Mommyyyy!
Broken already? Tsk! That's no fun. Guess it's time to finish this...
That's enough, Princess!
Hmm?
They've lost the will to fight. If you keep hurting them, you're going to kill them.
Isn't that the point?
We do not kill needlessly in this army. Now stop.
...Huh.
Fine, then. Go away, you.
EEEEEEK!
I don't know why you stopped me. The Empire is your enemy.
In Embla, we kill our enemies.
I understand that your world and ours have a number of differences.
However, that's not how we do things here. Just because someone is our enemy doesn't give us the right to toy with them.
Hmm...
So while you're with us, I'd prefer it if you...er...took it easy on the killing.
Is that too much to ask?
If you won't let me play with enemies, YOU have to play with me instead.
All right—then it's a promise.
...A promise.
I haven't made a promise like this in a long time. You people are strange.
The history between Askr and Embla is complicated to say the least.
The former emperor of Embla sought to bring prosperity to his country by enslaving Heroes, as well as Askr itself.
Several years ago, Princess Veronica suddenly declared her intention to follow in her father's footsteps and commenced a new invasion of Askr.
My sister once said she might have done it because she was lonely, but I don't know the truth of it.
Thank you for telling me all of that. I actually think your sister might not be too far off the mark.
Yes, she tried to kill those soldiers, but she doesn't strike me as a bad person, per se.
I think she just doesn't know how to make friends.
Many of us have long suspected the same.
Oh no! Veronica!
I fear something ill may have occurred. Come, Prince! We must make haste!
Okay, what's going on?
I came to Veronica's room in the vain hope of finally cleaning it and found her lying motionless on the floor.
Well, she's still breathin' at least. ...Heeey! Can you heeeear me?!
Hmm? What was that?
...Hungry.
What?!
...I'm full now.
I'm glad to hear that. But what possessed you to starve yourself for so long?
No one brought food to my room.
What?! Wait, no. Needs more surprise. ...WHAAAAT?!
Food always appears in my room at home. It never did here.
Eventually, I was too hungry to move.
Ah, I get it. Back in Embla, you have servants who bring you food.
*sigh* I thought I was being considerate by leaving her alone to her own devices, but if I had gone in earlier, none of this would have happened.
Please do not blame yourself, Cleo. If Princess Veronica was hungry, she had but to tell us so.
It's all right to rely on us, Princess, just as you did during the time when you lost your memory.
No. We're not fighting now, but I won't owe anything to the prince of another country.
Listen, Veronica...
What?
There are all kinds of people here in this castle, from lots of different classes and backgrounds. But even so, we all have one thing in common...
We're all friends.
I'm not a prince or a title. I am Euden, just as you're Veronica.
Why would you choose not to be a prince? That's strange. You're strange.
Stranger than any of the Heroes I've met from other worlds.
Oh, he's a strange one, all right.
But he's just tryin' to tell you it's okay to be free and live life how you want.
That might've been hard to do back home, but so long as you're in our world, just put all that royalty stuff out of your head and try to be our friend!
That's what I want, anyway! You're kinda like a little sister I want to help out.
Is there anyone normal in this castle?
I am with them in this, Princess Veronica.
This is neither Askr nor Embla. And until we find a way back home, we're all after the same thing.
All right. I'll try to be...friends. But only since it's temporary.
Hot damn! Let's shake on it!
Ow. Let go. You're hurting me.
Ack! Sorry! I did it the same way I shake hands with my sister, and she's kind of a beast. ...How's this?
Better.
Really? Good!
You're strange AND naive. What a troublesome bunch.
But a promise is a promise. I'll keep it.
That's what my brother once taught me...
There you are; all clean. It is a great boon to have such fine horses.
Neeeigh!
Now I just need to give them all a good brushing and I can... Hmm?
What is it, Princess Veronica?
You have horses. Can I ride one?
Certainly. Shall I teach you how?
I know how.
I see. Did you grow up riding horses?
I had two people who taught me to ride. One was my older brother.
I haven't seen him in a while. I wonder where he is...
...This happened a little while ago. She seemed quite lonely as she spoke of her brother—he must have been a very lovely person.
Huh. I always thought she seemed like a little sister, but I didn't know she really WAS someone's little sister.
It's no surprise she'd be lonely if she hasn't seen her sibling in a while. I know exactly how that feels.
Think we can do something to take her mind off it?
I mean, we're both older brothers, yeah? And while we can't be her family, we can at least try and help her have fun.
I suppose we DID just promise to all be friends...
Great! Then let's invite her somewhere.
Why did you bring me outside?
'Cause I wanted to show you all the rare animals that live deep inside the forest!
There are loads of cute critters here. ...Hey, look! There's some now!
Squeak!
Bleeeeat!
Tweet tweet!
D'aw! You gotta love 'em, right?
Not interested.
Whaaat?! Oh man, that's weird. Sarisse would have been freakin' out if I showed her a bunch of cute animals.
And now it's your turn? What are you trying to do?
You always have a book with you, so I thought I'd read you one of my favorite stories.
Reading is okay, I guess. But I mostly read magical grimoires.
Good enough! See, writing stories is sort of a hobby of mine, so I thought I'd share my latest work with you.
It's called ＂The Prince of a Lost Country and the Swindled—＂
Not interested.
R-really? Gee, Zethia always loved it when I read to her...
Okay, I don't get how to do this at ALL! It's like little sisters have become a total mystery to me!
What are we doing wrong?
What's going on, you two? You both look terribly depressed.
Well, Veronica was feelin' low after being separated from her brother, so we were tryin' to cheer her up.
But nothing we do makes her happy at all. Maybe we're both failures as brothers.
Is that what you've been doing? You can stop doing it now.
You'll never take my brother's place.
Wait, Alfonse! You're ALSO an older  brother, right? Because in that case, it's time for a Triple Brother Offensive!
It's true that my sister is younger than I, but... Er...
Well, perhaps we could go to town and shop for dresses or sweets.
Don't need any.
Listen to me. I miss my brother. It makes me sad and lonely.
But I don't want any of you to try and take his place.
But if you're sad, what can it hurt?
Because while I'm here, I'm just Veronica.
Not a princess or a sister—just Veronica. That's what you said.
...You remembered.
Of course I did. So was it a lie?
What? No! Of course not! Ha ha ha! Still, I guess you see us as friends more than we thought, huh?
Why do you assume that?
Heh. I believe they're just glad you remembered your promise.
Oh. Huh.
Don't worry. So long as I'm in this castle, I'll keep my promises.
We believe you, Veronica.
Well, we might not be able to become your brothers, but we can still have fun!
What a nice night. I should go for a walk.
Hmm. I guess everyone is asleep. There's no one he...
Ah! That looked like my brother! Wait! Come back!
*pant* *pant* I can't find him anywhere...
Were my eyes playing tricks?
Might I have a moment of your time, Your Highness?
The Black Raven Harle
I know you.
You certainly do! I am Harle of the Dyrenell Empire, and I have come to escort you back with me.
Why?
Because I know you grow weary of living with that goody-goody prince!
Deep down, you are both brutal and cold— and you know it. The Empire is a far more fitting place for you to be.
Not interested. Also, I'm tired. I'm going back now.
Well, that is a shame. But you really SHOULD reconsider, because I will use force if I must.
Tsk. What a tedious man you are. I guess I'll do this the hard way.
Aaargh!
Uh oh. They're in a LOT of pain. You should probably go now.
Well, THIS is strange! I heard tale upon tale of the merciless princess of Embla who killed anyone she deemed her enemy.
Heavens, you aren't HOLDING BACK, are you? If you consider us enemies, you really should try to kill us.
You are the castle's enemy... but I won't kill you.
Whyever not?
Because I promised the prince to be friends while I was here.
Aaaah ha ha ha! Friends? FRIENDS?! Simply unbelievable! Aaaah ha ha!
What's so funny?
Hoooo! Friends! Oh, goodness me. Well, I mean, you don't honestly TRUST these people, do you?
To you, they're just Heroes from another realm—and I've heard plenty about how such relationships usually end with you: They turn their backs and betray you!
It will be so very sad when the same thing happens this time, won't it?
That's why you should come with us to the Empire. Shared goals won't betray you like ＂friends＂ will—a fact you know well.
And if you decide to kill them before they manage to betray you, know that you have the Empire's complete and full support.
Veronicaaa! Where aaaaare you?!
That's the prince.
Bah. I see we are out of time. Very well, I will withdraw for today.
But I look forward to an answer you won't regret when we next meet, Your Highness. Until then...farewell!
*pant* There you are, Veronica! Thank goodness you're safe!
What'd you wander off all alone for? If you wanted to take in the night air, we'd have been happy to tag along.
What are you doing here?
We couldn't find you anywhere and got worried. It's dangerous around here at night, you know?
Still, you're okay, and that's what matters. So, um, you wanna keep walkin'? I could come with you.
The stars ARE lovely tonight. Still, if you want to go on night walks in the future, Veronica, please let one of us know so we don't worry. Okay?
The future... Okay.
It's settled. ...Now gimme your hand. I'm gonna make sure you don't get lost on the way back to the castle.
No. I'm not a child.
Trust... Shared goals... I don't know what to do...
Did you say something, Veronica?
No. And stop holding out your hand. I'm fine on my own.
...What should I do?
Who's making all that noise at this time of night? I can't sleep!
...Hmm. No one there. Did they go outside?
Princess Veronica! Quickly, come with me!
Alfonse?
Someone wishes to speak with you. Let us make haste!
Stop tugging me!
There he is.
Good evening, Your Highness. I've come to collect you, as agreed.
You! I made no such arrangement. And Alfonse, why...
Ah. You're Loki.
Oh, fiddlesticks! I should have known my disguise wouldn't last long against you.
And here I was hoping your loathing for Alfonse would cloud your judgment.
It seems you two have grown closer than I was expecting. How charming!
We tried it your way, Loki—now we will try it mine. Come here, Princess, or I will be forced to... Hmm?
Hold it right there!
What are you doing in this... Er, Princess Veronica?
Tsk! MUST I be thwarted at every turn by this pack of pathetic do-gooders?!
Ah, but this is actually the PERFECT time for them to arrive, because now we have both princes sitting in front of us!
Oh ho! Loki, you ARE a sly devil. Indeed, this is a wonderful opportunity to help Her Highness realize the truth of her feelings.
Get away from her!
You must slaughter the both of them, Your Highness. Before they can betray you.
Quiet. I have no intention of killing them at the moment.
Oh? But killing them would be such FUN! Come now, let us see just a teeensy glimpse of your amazing power.
Why hold back? Heed the whispers of your heart, dear.
Kill.
Ah!
Askr must be destroyed!
Ugh... Urrghh... Aaaaagh!
Veronica, wait! What are you doing?!
Aaaah ha ha! Oh, what naive fools you are! She's been secretly wanting to kill you before you abandon her—and she's wanted to do it this ENTIRE time!
Oh, what cruelty from such a sweet, innocent soul! Now go, my darling! Slay them with your own two hands!
Princess Veronica!
Brother... I... Promise... Aaargh!
Oh? Why did you stop? Kill them already!
I promised...not to.
For heaven's sake! You might try to ignore your primal instinct for the sake of some sappy promise, but how long can you REALLY hold out?
As long as I need to...
But WHY?!
Because I'm Veronica.
Not a princess—just Veronica.
So I'll keep my promise...for now.
Ah!
*sigh* Well, this is a TERRIBLE bore!
I couldn't agree more. I had thought her more wise than this, but I see we have been wasting our time. Let us be off.
No matter what happens here, know that tragedy WILL occur when you finally return to your home world.
And I look forward to being VEEERY entertained by it. Tee hee hee hee!
Heeeeey! Are you two okay? ...Whoa, what's up, Veronica? You're super pale!
I will attend to her at once. But what happened to Harle and Loki?
Veronica drove them away.
Thank you, Princess Veronica. Thank you for keeping your word.
I didn't do anything.
That's not true. You did great—and we were all happy to see that what we said left such a mark on you.
Such praise from the prince is quite exceptional. To celebrate, what would you like me to make for dinner?
Hey, I want in on this praising action! C'mere, kid! I'm gonna give you a Luca Head-Rub Special!
Don't treat me like a child.
Ha ha! Don't be too harsh on him. He's just trying to make you happy.
I'm sure your brother would be happy if he was here, but we at least want to praise you in his stead.
Stop trying to replace him! *sigh*
You really are a strange bunch. I don't know how to deal with you.
But...maybe it's okay once in a while.
